message:
I'm looking for an HTML Treeview control. It should:
- Support making HTTP/AJAX calls on expanding nodes (lazy loading).
- Doesn't require that the JSON response be in a certain format. Or, at least allow me to re-format the response (I don't have control over the response or server).
- Icons for nodes.
- Events (clicking a node).
- Bootstrap support is a plus.
I'm looking into JSTree http://www.jstree.com/ but it's not quite right (or maybe I can't get it to work correctly)
Any suggestions?
Thank you
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message:
jsTree is good, it supports Events,Icons and AJAX calls but with specific formats for HTML/JSON as mentioned in the documentations, BTW i think you will need to implement -yourself- a little wrapper for your server calls to re-format the response to what the tree component need then inject it (API over API, so you on control now).
i have tried an old basic JQuery Tree component later, it supports Lazy loading with AJAX but the return response should be the RAW HTML to be injected.
http://labs.abeautifulsite.net/archived/jquery-fileTree/demo/
Not sure, but I think this with some tweaks will work, http://www.primefaces.org/primeui/tree.html
i think Dojo toolkit has these features except integration with bootstrap

Eslam Hamouda I really liked jsTree but I have no control over the servers I'm calling. So, that won't work.
Mohamed Shehata This looks promising, I'll look into it.
Emad Elsaid Dojo is great in its completeness, but it's so freaking complicated. To do the simplest thing, I have to write and understand a shit load of code. It's the .NET of Javascript frameworks. However, it might work. Also, there's a bootstrap theme for Dojo now but it doesn't support the tree dijit.
http://dojobootstrap.com/

Looks like I'll use jsTree. I figured out why creating nodes wasn't working. For some reason, they have creating nodes disabled by default. You have to change the configurations before you can create nodes.
Thanks everyone.
